title: Ligurian Chickpea and Porcini Soup
introduction: Ligurian Chickpea and Porcini Soup is a comforting and hearty dish from the coastal region of Liguria. This version includes a delightful mix of porcini mushrooms, chickpeas, and Swiss chard, complemented by the savory notes of pancetta and aromatics. Warm, filling, and rich in flavor, this soup embodies the essence of Italian countryside cooking.
ingredients: 3 cups cooked dried or drained canned chickpeas
8 ounces Swiss chard, cut crosswise into narrow strips
1 medium boiling potato, peeled and chopped
1 cup peeled, seeded, and chopped fresh or canned tomatoes
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 cup ditalini, tubetti, or other small pasta
instructions: Soak the mushrooms in the water for 30 minutes. Remove them and reserve the liquid. Rinse the mushrooms under cold running water to remove any grit. Chop them coarsely. Strain the liquid through a paper coffee filter into a bowl.
Pour the oil into a large pot. Add the pancetta, onion, carrot, celery, and garlic. Cook, stirring frequently, over medium heat until the onion and other aromatics are golden, about 10 minutes.

Stir in the chickpeas, Swiss chard, potato, tomatoes, and mushrooms with their liquid. Add water to just cover the ingredients, and salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a simmer and cook until the vegetables are tender and the soup is thickened, about 1 hour. Add water if the soup becomes too thick.
Stir in the pasta and 2 more cups water. Cook, stirring often, about 15 minutes, or until the pasta is tender. Let cool slightly before serving.
variations: Some cooks make this soup without the Swiss chard, while others include cardoons in the ingredients.
